WordNet with NLTK

15 June 2018

You can use WordNet together with NLTK to identify the meanings of words, synonyms, antonyms, and more. Let’s look at an example. # first you import wordnet. from nltk.corpus import wordnet # we use a term "program" to find synsets. syns = wordnet.synsets("program") # examples of outputs. print(syns[0].name()) print(syns[0].lemmas()[0].name()) print(syns[0].definition())...

Wordnet, Lexicon Database

14 June 2018

Wordnet, what is this? It’s nothing short of a great lexical database in English. Nouns, verbs, adjectives and adverbs are grouped into sets of cognitive synonyms, each expressing a distinct concept. The framework makes it a useful tool for computational linguistics and natural language processing. Wordnet superficially resembles a synonym...
